model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
About that Bluegrass show -- A friend of mine mentioned that he has a cabin he won't be using only about 20 minutes away. Do you and your wife want to stay there so you can make it? Might be a more comfortable way for your wife to camp. Let me know. 
That would be lovely! We can totally pay your friend to use the cabin if they would like.
I will let them my friend know that you are interested.  I think I might head out that way myself and camp out for the festival too.
Nice! Is anyone coming with you?
Just my doggy Drunky.  You never know,  I might meet a nice lady out there. 
Totally.  There will be a bunch of women there and it'll be easy to strike up conversations.  Just be confident and I'm sure you could walk away with a bunch of numbers.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Festivals and family plans', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A talks about festivals and family plans, while Speaker B shares experiences with his pregnant wife and upcoming baby.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Yeah! I love camping out and they have such cool food there and all kinds of drinks. Love to sleep over and wake up to some great music. Yes, it's the alternator, but, don't worry, I'll get you a good price and repair it.  ### Speaker A: I always over do it with the food and drink when I go. It is worth it though when you can just wake up and go straight to the stage to watch some live music.  ### Speaker B: Yes, I miss that. I'll ask my wife if she's up to going. Since she's pregnant, I let her make the rules. ### Speaker A: Ah you might have to give the festivals a miss for a few years. I can not imagine camping with a small baby! ### Speaker B: Ha! Yes. But, she's still got another trimester to go, so she may want to go just for the day. But, yeah, I wouldn't go camping with a small baby either. ### Speaker A: You might have to go soon then and like you say just go along for the day. Your wife would probably get quite tired with all the walking and standing though. ### Speaker B: We have one that is local and I think we'll try that. And, I'll let her just sit by the stage while I get all the food and run around.  ### Speaker A: So tell me, did you and your wife end up going to your local festival? ### Speaker B: We were on the way out the door and unfortunately she suddenly had really bad morning sickness so we had to pulll out, such a bummer!  ### Speaker A: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that! Is she feeling any better? There will be other events, as long as she is ok.  ### Speaker B: It's true! Obviously her and the baby are the main priority, so I was okay with it. And not really, she's sort of been sick since then unfortunately. Have you gone to a concert yet this week? Might have to live vicariously through your music-going for the time being haha' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Concert plans and impending arrival', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A discusses attending concerts and plans for the coming weeks, while Speaker B talks about his wife's pregnancy and work status.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: It's true! Obviously her and the baby are the main priority, so I was okay with it. And not really, she's sort of been sick since then unfortunately. Have you gone to a concert yet this week? Might have to live vicariously through your music-going for the time being haha ### Speaker A: Lol, yeah I hear ya. I haven't yet been to one, but its almost the weekend lol. I hear there is a bluegrass band playing in the next town over, going to go check them out. Should be a quiet, small event, if she is up to it. How much longer until she is due? ### Speaker B: Oh cool, I might actually ask her! We both love bluegrass so that sounds great. And she's got another three months to go ### Speaker A: OOo, getting close! By next season, you will be able to go camping again hopefully. I can't imagine it is comfortable for her at this stage. Is she still working?  ### Speaker B: I know, it's pretty crazy. Hopefully but maybe not with the baby haha. And yeah she's still working but only for a couple more weeks. Do you imagine you and Drunky wiill ever settle down, do the whole wife and kids thing?' }
```
